Title: SQL Language Expressions
Description: The OR operator is used to combine two or more boolean expressions. It returns true if at least one of the expressions evaluates to true; otherwise, it returns false.
Parameters: Two or more boolean expressions.
Returns: True if at least one expression is true; otherwise, false.
Examples: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE status = 'pending' OR status = 'shipped'; -- Finds orders that are either pending or shipped
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1 OR department_id = 2; -- Finds employees in either department 1 or 2
